intro: Anacyclus × alboranensis, commonly known as the Alboran dandelion, is a hybrid plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly around the Alboran Sea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its composite flower heads and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and arid environments. Its flowers are yellow, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Anacyclus × alboranensis is of interest to botanists due to its hybrid origin and ecological adaptability.
